<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Z.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#1
60;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><u 
style="font-weight:bold;">No Applicable Nonbankruptcy Law Regarding Transfers 
(11 U.S.C. &#167; 1129(a)(16)).</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">28.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The 
Debtors are moneyed, business, or commercial corporations.&#160; Accordingly, 
section 1129(a)(16) of the Bankruptcy Code is inapplicable in the Chapter 11 
Cases.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">AA.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#1
60;&#160; </font><b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Confirmation of Plan Over Non-
Acceptance of Impaired Classes 
(11&nbsp;U.S.C.&nbsp;&#167;&nbsp;1129(b)).</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">29.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The Plan
may be confirmed pursuant to section 1129(b)&nbsp;of the Bankruptcy Code 
notwithstanding that the requirements of section 1129(a)(8)&nbsp;have not been 
met, because the Debtors have demonstrated by a preponderance of the evidence 
that the Plan (a)&nbsp;satisfies all of the other requirements of section 
1129(a)&nbsp;of the Bankruptcy Code and (b)&nbsp;does not &#147;discriminate 
unfairly&#148; and is &#147;fair and equitable&#148; with respect to the 
Rejecting Classes.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">30.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The Plan
does not &#147;discriminate unfairly&#148; against any Holders of Claims and 
Interests in Classes 5a, 5b, 5c, and 11 (the &#147;<u>Rejecting 
Classes</u>&#148;).&#160; The treatment of such Holders is proper because all 
similarly situated Holders of Claims and Interests will receive substantially 
similar treatment, and the Debtors have a valid rationale, including for the 
rationales articulated in the Confirmation Brief, for the Plan&#146;s 
classification scheme and the disparate treatment, if any, provided for 
different Classes.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">31.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The Plan
is also &#147;fair and equitable&#148; with respect to each Rejecting 
Class.&#160; No Holder of Claims or Interests junior to any Rejecting 
Class&nbsp;is receiving a distribution under the Plan.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">32.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The 
Plan, therefore, satisfies the requirements of section 1129(b)&nbsp;of the 
Bankruptcy Code and may be confirmed despite the fact that not all Impaired 
Classes have voted to accept the Plan.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">16<a name="PB_16_121838_3736"></a></p>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='16',FILE='C:\JMS\105039\16-16038-1\task8047770\16038-1-ks-

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">BB.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#1
60;&#160; </font><b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Only One Plan (11 U.S.C. &#167;
1129(c)).</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">33.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The Plan
is the only plan filed in the Chapter 11 Cases, and, accordingly, 
section&nbsp;1129(c)&nbsp;of the Bankruptcy Code is inapplicable in the Chapter 
11 Cases.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">CC.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#1
60;&#160; </font><b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Principal Purpose of the Plan 
(11 U.S.C. &#167;&nbsp;1129(d)).</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">34.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The 
principal purpose of the Plan is not the avoidance of taxes or the avoidance of 
the application of section 5 of the Securities Act of 1933, thereby satisfying 
section 1129(d)&nbsp;of the Bankruptcy Code.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">DD.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#1
60;&#160; </font><b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Not Small Business Cases (11 
U.S.C. &#167; 1129(e)).</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">35.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; None of 
the Chapter 11 Cases are small business cases, as that term is defined in the 
Bankruptcy Code, and accordingly, section&nbsp;1129(e)&nbsp;of the Bankruptcy 
Code is inapplicable in the Chapter 11 Cases.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">EE.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#1
60;&#160; </font><b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Plan 
Implementation.</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">36.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The 
terms of the Plan, including, without limitation, the Plan Supplement and all 
exhibits and schedules thereto, the D&amp;O Notices, the Management Incentive 
Plan, the Supplemental Schedule of Rejected Executory Contracts, the Second 
Supplemental Schedule of Rejected Executory Contracts, the Third Supplemental 
Schedule of Rejected Executory Contracts, and all other documents filed in 
connection with the Plan, or executed or to be executed in connection with the 
transactions contemplated by the Plan and all amendments and modifications of 
any of the foregoing made pursuant to the provisions of the Plan governing such 
amendments and modifications (collectively, the &#147;<u>Plan 
Documents</u>&#148;) are incorporated by reference, are approved in all 
respects, and constitute an integral part of this Confirmation Order.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FF.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#1
60;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Binding and 
Enforceable.</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">37.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The Plan
and the Plan Documents have been negotiated in good faith and at arm&#146;s 
length and, subject to the occurrence of the Effective Date, shall bind any 
Holder of a Claim or </font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">17<a name="PB_17_121909_9621"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade 
align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='17',FILE='C:\JMS\105039\16-16038-1\task8047770\16038-1-ks-
03.htm',USER='105039',CD='Aug  3 12:24 2016' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Interest and such Holder&#146;s respective successors 
and assigns, whether or not the Claim or Interest is Impaired under the Plan, 
whether or not such Holder has accepted the Plan, and whether or not such Holder
is entitled to a distribution under the Plan.&#160; The Plan and the Plan 
Documents constitute legal, valid, binding, and authorized obligations of the 
respective parties thereto and shall be enforceable in accordance with their 
terms.&#160; Pursuant to section 1142(a)&nbsp;of the Bankruptcy Code, the Plan 
and the Plan Documents shall apply and be enforceable notwithstanding any 
otherwise applicable nonbankruptcy law.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">GG.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 
</font><b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Vesting of Assets.</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">38.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Except 
as otherwise provided in the Plan or any agreement, instrument, or other 
document incorporated therein, on the Effective Date, all property in each 
Estate, all Causes of Action (other than the Released Claims and the Settled 
Claims), and any property acquired by any of the Debtors pursuant to the Plan 
shall vest in each respective Reorganized Debtor, free and clear of all Liens, 
Claims, charges, Causes of Action, or other encumbrances.&#160; On and after the
Effective Date, except as otherwise provided in the Plan, each Reorganized 
Debtor may operate its business and may use, acquire, or dispose of property and
compromise or settle any Claims,&nbsp;Interests, or Causes of Action without 
supervision or approval by the Bankruptcy Court and free of any restrictions of 
the Bankruptcy Code or Bankruptcy Rules.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">HH.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 
</font><b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Management Incentive Plan.</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">39.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The 
Debtors have provided sufficient and adequate notice of the terms of the 
Management Incentive Plan.&#160; The terms and conditions of the Management 
Incentive Plan have been negotiated in good faith and at arm&#146;s length with 
the Debtors&#146; primary stakeholders.&#160; The Management Incentive Plan is 
an essential element of the Plan, and the terms of the Management Incentive Plan
and the payments contemplated therein are reasonable and comparable to the 
market.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">18<a name="PB_18_121931_8715"></a></p>

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">II.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#1
60;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><u 
style="font-weight:bold;">Approval of the Exit Revolver Credit 
Facility.</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">40.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The Exit
Revolver Credit Facility is an essential element of the Plan, is necessary for 
Confirmation and the consummation of the Plan, and is critical to the overall 
success and feasibility of the Plan.&#160; Entry into the Exit Revolver Credit 
Facility Agreement and the other Exit Revolver Credit Facility Documents is in 
the best interests of the Debtors, their Estates, and all Holders of Claims or 
Interests.&#160; The Debtors have exercised reasonable business judgment in 
determining to enter into the Exit Revolver Credit Facility Agreement and the 
other Exit Revolver Credit Facility Documents and have provided sufficient and 
adequate notice of the material terms of the Exit Revolver Credit Facility, 
which material terms were filed as part of the Plan Supplement.&#160; The terms 
and conditions of the Exit Revolver Credit Facility are fair and reasonable, and
the Exit Revolver Credit Facility was negotiated in good faith and at arm&#146;s
length.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">JJ.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#1
60;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><u style="font-
weight:bold;">Approval of the New Second Lien Credit Facility.</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">41.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The New 
Second Lien Credit Facility is an essential element of the Plan, is necessary 
for Confirmation and the consummation of the Plan, and is critical to the 
overall success and feasibility of the Plan.&#160; Entry into the New Second 
Lien Credit Facility Agreement and the other New Second Lien Credit Facility 
Documents is in the best interests of the Debtors, their Estates, and all 
Holders of Claims or Interests.&#160; The Debtors have exercised reasonable 
business judgment in determining to enter into the New Second Lien Credit 
Facility Agreement and the other New Second Lien Credit Facility Documents and 
have provided sufficient and adequate notice of the material terms of the New 
Second Lien Credit Facility, which material terms were filed as part of the Plan
Supplement.&#160; The terms and conditions of the New Second Lien Credit 
Facility are fair and reasonable, and the New Second Lien Credit Facility was 
negotiated in good faith and at arm&#146;s length.</font></p>

#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 
</font><b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Issuance of New Common Stock and 
Warrants.</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">42.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; To the 
maximum extent provided by section 1145 of the Bankruptcy Code and applicable 
non-bankruptcy law, the offering, issuance, and distribution of the New Common 
Stock and Warrants and any other securities to be issued and distributed 
(including the distributions described in the Restructuring Transactions), 
whether on the Effective Date or any other date of a distribution thereafter, 
pursuant to the terms of the Plan or in accordance with this Confirmation Order,
comply with section 1145 of the Bankruptcy Code and shall be exempt from, among 
other things, the registration requirements of Section&nbsp;5 of the Securities 
Act and any other applicable U.S., state or local law requiring registration 
prior to the offering, issuance, distribution, or sale of securities.&#160; The 
issuance of New Common Stock to Holders of RBL Secured Claims is in exchange for
a portion of the RBL Secured Claim.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">43.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; In 
addition, under section 1145 of the Bankruptcy Code, any securities contemplated
by the Plan and any and all agreements incorporated therein, including the New 
Common Stock and Warrants, shall be subject to (a)&nbsp;the provisions of 
section 1145(b)(1)&nbsp;of the Bankruptcy Code relating to the definition of an 
underwriter in section 2(a)(11) of the Securities Act; (b)&nbsp;compliance with 
any rules&nbsp;and regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission, if 
any, applicable at the time of any future transfer of such securities or 
instruments; (c)&nbsp;the restrictions, if any, on the transferability of such 
securities and instruments, including those set forth in the New Organizational 
Documents; and (d)&nbsp;applicable regulatory approval, if any.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">44.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Each 
share of the New Common Stock issued pursuant to the Plan shall be duly 
authorized, validly issued, fully paid, and non-assessable.&#160; Each 
distribution and issuance of the New Common Stock and Warrants referred to in 
Article&nbsp;VI of the Plan shall be governed by the terms and conditions set 
forth in the Plan applicable to such distribution or issuance and by the terms 
and conditions of the instruments evidencing or relating to such distribution or
issuance,</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">which terms and conditions shall bind each Entity 
receiving such distribution or issuance.&#160; The New Common Stock and Warrants
need not be issued through the facilities of the DTC.&#160; The Debtors, 
Reorganized Debtors, or New Holdco may deliver stock certificates evidencing 
shares of New Common Stock to holders of such New Common Stock upon the request 
of a holder (collectively with its affiliates) of at least 5% of New Common 
Stock in accordance with the provisions of the New Organizational 
Documents.&#160; The Debtors, the Reorganized Debtors, or New Holdco may elect 
to issue New Common Stock or Warrants through the facilities of the DTC, whether
on the Effective Date or on a date after the Effective Date.&#160; Neither New 
Holdco nor the Reorganized Debtors need to provide any further evidence other 
than the Plan and this Confirmation Order with respect to the treatment of the 
New Common Stock or Warrants under applicable securities laws.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-

#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#1
60;&#160; </font><b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Executory Contracts and 
Unexpired Leases.</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">45.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The 
Debtors have exercised sound business judgment in determining whether to assume 
or reject each of their Executory Contracts and Unexpired Leases pursuant to 
sections 365 and 1123(b)(2)&nbsp;of the Bankruptcy Code, Article&nbsp;V of the 
Plan, and as set forth in the Plan Supplement.&#160; Except as set forth herein 
and/or in separate orders entered by the Court relating to assumption of 
Executory Contracts or Unexpired Leases, the Debtors have cured or provided 
adequate assurances that the Debtors will cure defaults (if any) under or 
relating to each Executory Contract or Unexpired Lease assumed under the 
Plan.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">46.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Nothing 
in the Plan or the Confirmation Order shall prevent a party to an Executory 
Contract rejected pursuant to the Plan from filing a Proof of Claim based on 
such rejection within thirty (30) days after the effective date of rejection of 
such Executory Contract.&nbsp; Nothing in the Plan or this Confirmation Order 
shall prevent a party to an Executory Contract assumed pursuant to the Plan, or 
otherwise, from continuing to prosecute an objection to the </font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">21<a name="PB_21_122536_4545"></a></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cure Cost related to such assumed Executory Contract 
if such objection was timely filed on or before June&nbsp;3, 2016 at 5:00 p.m., 
prevailing Eastern Time, but not resolved before the Effective Date.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">MM.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><u style="font-
weight:bold;">Discharge, Compromise, Settlement, Release, Exculpation, and 
Injunction Provisions.</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">47.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The 
Court has jurisdiction under sections 1334(a)&nbsp;and (b)&nbsp;of title 28 of 
the United States Code to approve the discharge, compromises, settlements, 
releases, exculpations, and injunctions set forth in Article&nbsp;VIII of the 
Plan.&#160; Sections 105(a)&nbsp;and 1123(b)&nbsp;of the Bankruptcy Code permit 
issuance of the injunctions and approval of the releases, exculpations, and 
injunctions set forth in Article&nbsp;VIII of the Plan.&#160; Based upon the 
record of the Chapter 11 Cases and the evidence proffered or adduced at the 
Confirmation Hearing, the Court finds that the discharge, compromises, 
settlements, releases, exculpations, and injunctions set forth in 
Article&nbsp;VIII of the Plan are consistent with the Bankruptcy Code and
applicable law.&#160; Further, the discharge, compromises, settlements, 
releases, exculpations, and injunctions contained in Article&nbsp;VIII of the 
Plan are integral components of the Plan and the Settlement.&#160; The 
discharge, compromises, settlements, releases, exculpations, and injunctions set
forth in Article&nbsp;VIII of the Plan are hereby approved and authorized in 
their entirety.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">48.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The 
distributions and other consideration provided by Holders of RBL Secured Claims 
under the Plan are sufficient under Bankruptcy Rule&nbsp;9019 to support the 
binding waivers and releases of any and all claims and causes of action that 
have been asserted or could have been asserted prior to the Effective Date with 
respect to any disputes arising in connection with or otherwise related to the 
Settlement.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">22<a name="PB_22_122550_7056"></a></p>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='22',FILE='C:\JMS\105039\16-16038-1\task8047770\16038-1-ks-
05.htm',USER='105039',CD='Aug  3 12:29 2016' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NN.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#1
60;&#160; </font><b><u style="font-weight:bold;">RBL Released Party 
Release.</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">49.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The 
release and injunction in favor of the RBL Released Parties described in 
Article&nbsp;VIII.B and Article&nbsp;VIII.I of the Plan (the &#147;<u>RBL 
Release</u>&#148;) are an integral and necessary part of the Plan, represent a 
valid exercise of the Debtors&#146; business judgment, and are in the best 
interests of the estates.&#160; For the reasons set forth on the record of the 
Chapter 11 Cases and the evidence proffered or adduced at the Confirmation 
Hearing, including the Plan and Settlement embodied therein, the RBL 
Agent&#146;s and the RBL Lenders&#146; agreement to support the Plan is 
conditioned upon approval of the RBL Release, without which the RBL Agent and 
the RBL Lenders would not have supported the Plan.&#160; The RBL Agent has 
insisted since the beginning of plan negotiations that the Plan contain a full 
release.&#160; Without the RBL Release, the RBL Agent and the RBL Lenders would 
not have agreed to make substantial contributions to the Plan or support the 
Settlement therein.&#160; The RBL Release, therefore, is an inextricable and 
critical component of the Plan.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">50.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; For the 
reasons set forth on the record of the Chapter 11 Cases and the evidence
proffered or adduced at the Confirmation Hearing, including the Plan and 
Settlement embodied therein, the RBL Agent and the RBL Lenders have provided 
substantial consideration in exchange for the RBL Release.&#160; Specifically, 
the RBL Agent and the RBL Lenders have agreed to, among other matters:&#160; 
(a)&nbsp;compromise the First Lien Adequate Protection Claim (as defined in the 
Cash Collateral Order); (b)&nbsp;receive New Common Stock in satisfaction of the
First Lien Adequate Protection Claim, despite their entitlement to receive 
payment in full in cash on account of the First Lien Adequate Protection Claim; 
(c)&nbsp;convert a substantial portion of the Allowed RBL Secured Claims into 
93% of the New Common Stock in the Reorganized Debtors; (d)&nbsp;waive their 
substantial unsecured deficiency claims; (e)&nbsp;provide commitments for the 
new $200 million Exit Revolver Credit Facility (with initial borrowing base 
availability of </font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">23<a name="PB_23_122619_5335"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade 
align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='23',FILE='C:\JMS\105039\16-16038-1\task8047770\16038-1-ks-
05.htm',USER='105039',CD='Aug  3 12:29 2016' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">$150&nbsp;million) to fund post-Effective Date 
operations of the Reorganized Debtors; (f)&nbsp;cede more than $70 million in 
value to the Second Lien Lenders by providing 5% of the New Common Stock in the 
Reorganized Debtors and 10-year Tranche 1 Warrants; (g)&nbsp;waive any right to 
enforce the lien subordination or other turnover rights under the Intercreditor 
Agreement and the Cash Collateral Order against any Second Lien Lender; 
(h)&nbsp;cede more than $28 million in value to Holders of Claims in Classes 5 
and 6 by providing 2% of the New Common Stock in the Reorganized Debtors and 10-
year Tranche 2 Warrants; (i)&nbsp;compromise without litigation the Bucket II 
Claims; and (j)&nbsp;compromise without litigation the claim that certain of the
adequate protection payments made by the Debtors to the RBL Agent and RBL 
Lenders under the Cash Collateral Order should be recharacterized as principal 
repayments by agreeing that any adequate protection payments received after 
October&nbsp;15, 2015 will be applied to reduce the principal amount of the RBL 
Secured Claim (the compromise described in subparagraph (k)&nbsp;shall be 
referred to herein as the &#147;<u>Additional Settlement</u>&#148;).&#160; In 
addition, there is an identity of interest between the Debtors and the RBL 
Released Parties because the Debtors have an obligation under the RBL Credit 
Agreement to indemnify the RBL Released Parties if any party pursued claims 
against the RBL Released Parties in connection with the RBL Credit Facility to 
the extent set forth therein.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">51.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Without 
the substantial contributions to the Plan made by the RBL Agent and RBL Lenders,
the Debtors would not have the ability to fund post-Effective Date operations or
comply with their other obligations under the Plan, and Holders of Claims in 
Classes 4-7 would not be entitled to distributions under the Plan.&#160; The RBL
Release is:&#160; (a)&nbsp;in exchange for good and valuable consideration 
provided by the RBL Released Parties; (b)&nbsp;a good-faith compromise and 
settlement of the Released Claims, the Settled Claims, and other Claims and 
Causes of </font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">24<a name="PB_24_122702_5796"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='24',FILE='C:\JMS\105039\16-16038-1\task8047770\16038-1-ks-

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Action released by the Debtors and third parties; 
(c)&nbsp;in the best interests of the Debtors and all Holders of Claims and 
Interests; (d)&nbsp;fair, equitable, and reasonable; (e)&nbsp;given and made 
after due notice and opportunity for hearing; and (f)&nbsp;a bar to any of the 
Debtors, the Reorganized Debtors, the Estates, the Second Lien Agent, the Second
Lien Lenders, the Senior Notes Indenture Trustees, the Senior Notes Holders, the
Committee and Committee Members, current direct and indirect Interest Holders in
Sabine, and any Holder of a Claim or Interest that would have been legally 
entitled to assert any Released Claim, Settled Claim, or any other Claim or 
Cause of Action from asserting any Released Claim, Settled Claim, or any other 
Claim or Cause of Action released under the RBL Release against any of the RBL 
Released Parties.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">OO.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 
</font><b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Debtor Release; Third Party 
Release.</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">52.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The 
releases described in Articles VIII.F and VIII.G of the Plan are an integral and
necessary part of the Plan and represent a valid exercise of the Debtors&#146; 
business judgment.&#160; For the reasons set forth on the record of the Chapter 
11 Cases and the evidence proffered or adduced at the Confirmation Hearing, 
including the Plan and Settlement embodied therein, the releases provided for in
the Plan are in the best interests of the estates.&#160; The releases described 
in Articles VIII.F and VIII.G of the Plan are:&#160; (a)&nbsp;in exchange for 
good and valuable consideration provided by the RBL Released Parties and other 
Released Parties; (b)&nbsp;a good-faith compromise and settlement of the 
Released Claims, the Settled Claims, and other Claims and Causes of Action 
released by the Debtors and third parties; (c)&nbsp;in the best interests of the
Debtors and all Holders of Claims and Interests; (d)&nbsp;fair, equitable, and 
reasonable; (e)&nbsp;given and made after due notice and opportunity for 
hearing; and (f)&nbsp;a bar to any of the Debtors, the Reorganized Debtors, or 
any Holder of a Claim or Interest that would have been legally entitled to 
assert any Released Claim, Settled Claim, or any other Claim or Cause of 
</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Action on behalf of any of the Debtors or the Estates 
from asserting any Released Claim, Settled Claim, or any other Claim or Cause of
Action released by the releases described in VIII.F and VIII.G of the Plan 
against any of the RBL Released Parties or any other Released Party.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">PP.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#1
60;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><u style="font-
weight:bold;">Exculpation.</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">53.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The 
exculpation provisions set forth in Article&nbsp;VIII.H of the Plan are 
essential to the Plan.&#160; The record in the Chapter 11 Cases fully supports 
the exculpation provisions, and the exculpation provisions set forth in 
Article&nbsp;VIII.H of the Plan are appropriately tailored to protect the 
Exculpated Parties from inappropriate litigation.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">QQ.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 
</font><b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Injunction.</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">54.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The 
injunction provisions set forth in Article&nbsp;VIII.I of the Plan are essential
to the Plan; are necessary to preserve and enforce the releases set forth in 
Articles VIII.B, VIII.E, VIII.F, and VIII.G of the Plan, the exculpation 
provisions in Article&nbsp;VIII.H of the Plan; and the compromises and 
settlements implemented under the Plan; and are narrowly tailored to achieve 
that purpose.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">55.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The 
injunction provisions set forth in Article&nbsp;VIII.I the Plan:&#160; 
(a)&nbsp;are within the jurisdiction of this Court under 28 U.S.C. 
&#167;&#167;&nbsp;1334(a), 1334(b), and 1334(d); (b)&nbsp;are an essential means
of implementing the Plan pursuant to section 1123(a)(5)&nbsp;of the Bankruptcy 
Code; (c)&nbsp;are an integral element of the transactions incorporated into the
Plan; (d)&nbsp;confer material benefits on, and are in the best interests of, 
the Debtors, the Estates, and their creditors; (e)&nbsp;are important to the 
overall objectives of the Plan to finally resolve all Released Claims, Settled 
Claims, Exculpated Claims, or any other Claims or Causes of Action among or 
against the parties in interest in the Chapter 11 Cases with respect to the
Debtors; and (f)&nbsp;are consistent with sections 105, 1123, and 1129 of the 
Bankruptcy Code, other provisions of the Bankruptcy Code, and other applicable 
law.&#160; The record of the Confirmation Hearing and the Chapter 11 Cases is 
sufficient to support the injunction provisions set forth in Article&nbsp;VIII.I
the Plan.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">RR.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#1
60;&#160; </font><b><u style="font-weight:bold;">The Settlement.</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">56.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Pursuant
to section 1123 of the Bankruptcy Code and Bankruptcy Rule&nbsp;9019, the Plan 
incorporates an integrated compromise and settlement of the Settled Claims, 
including the Additional Settlement and the amount of Collateral Diminution (as 
defined in the Cash Collateral Order) suffered by the RBL Lenders and Second 
Lien Lenders during the Chapter 11 Cases (collectively, the 
&#147;<u>Settlement</u>&#148;), and releases and settles the Released Claims and
Settled Claims, to achieve a beneficial and efficient resolution of the Chapter 
11 Cases for all parties in interest.&#160; If the Plan becomes effective in 
accordance with its terms, then the RBL Lenders shall be deemed to have accepted
the Settlement for all purposes in the Chapter 11 Cases.&#160; Pursuant to the 
Settlement, the RBL Lenders waive any right to a recovery or distribution of New
Common Stock and Warrants in the Second Lien Equity Pool and the Unsecured 
Equity Pool on account of their RBL Secured Claims and its First Lien Adequate 
Protection Claim (as defined in the Cash Collateral Order).&#160; In addition, 
the RBL Lenders agree that, pursuant to the Plan, the Holders of Claims in 
Classes 4 through 6 shall receive their Pro Rata share of New Common Stock and 
Warrants as provided in Article&nbsp;III of the Plan.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">57.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The 
Settlement and the distributions and other benefits provided for under the Plan,
including the releases set forth in Article&nbsp;VIII.B, Article&nbsp;VIII.F, 
and Article&nbsp;VIII.G and the exculpation set forth in Article&nbsp;VIII.H, 
shall be in full satisfaction of any and all potential Released Claims, Settled 
Claims, Exculpated Claims, or any other Claims or Causes of Action that could 
have been asserted, regardless of whether any of the foregoing Released Claims, 
Settled Claims, Exculpated Claims, or other Claims or Causes of Action are 
identified herein or in the Plan or could have been asserted.&#160; The RBL 
Agent and the RBL Lenders have agreed to permit distributions of the New Common 
Stock and Warrants set aside in the Second Lien Equity Pool and the Unsecured 
Equity Pool to be made to Holders of Allowed Second Lien </font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">27<a name="PB_27_122833_7748"></a></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Claims, Allowed Senior Notes Claims and Allowed 
General Unsecured Claims in order to settle the Settled Claims in exchange for 
the releases provided herein.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">58.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The 
entry of this Confirmation Order shall constitute the Court&#146;s approval 
pursuant to section 1123 of the Bankruptcy Code and Bankruptcy Rule&nbsp;9019, 
as of the Effective Date, of the compromise or settlement of all such Released 
Claims and Settled Claims and the Court&#146;s determination that such 
compromises and settlements are in the best interests of the Debtors, their 
estates, the Reorganized Debtors, creditors and all other parties in interest, 
and are fair, equitable, and well above the lowest point in the range of 
reasonableness.&#160; The compromises, settlements and releases described herein
shall be deemed nonseverable from each other and from all other terms of the 
Plan.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">59.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The 
Settlement (a)&nbsp;is a permitted means of implementing the Plan pursuant to 
section 1123(b)&nbsp;of the Bankruptcy Code; (b)&nbsp;is an integral element of 
the transactions incorporated into the Plan; (c)&nbsp;confers material benefits 
on, and is in the best interests of, the Debtors, the Estates, and their 
creditors; (d)&nbsp;is important to the overall objectives of the Plan to 
finally resolve all Settled Claims, Released Claims, and any other Claims or 
Causes of Action among or against the parties in interest in the Chapter 11 
Cases with respect to the Debtors; (e)&nbsp;is fair and equitable and represents
a resolution within the range of reasonableness; and (f)&nbsp;is consistent 
with, and satisfies the requirements of, sections 105, 1123, and 1129 of the 
Bankruptcy Code, other provisions of the Bankruptcy Code, Bankruptcy 
Rule&nbsp;9019, and other applicable law.&#160; The Settlement is therefore 
approved.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">SS.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#1
60;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><u style="font-
weight:bold;">Retention of Jurisdiction.</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">60.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Except
as otherwise provided in any of the Plan Documents, the Court shall retain 
jurisdiction over the Chapter 11 Cases and all matters arising out of, or 
related to, the Chapter 11 Cases and the Plan, including the matters set forth 
in Article&nbsp;XI of the Plan.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='28',FILE='C:\JMS\105039\16-16038-1\task8047770\16038-1-ks-
05.htm',USER='105039',CD='Aug  3 12:29 2016' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">TT.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#1
60;&#160; </font><b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Good Faith.</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">61.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The 
Debtors have proposed the Plan (including the Plan Documents and all other 
documents necessary to effectuate the Plan) in good faith and not by any means 
forbidden by the law, thereby satisfying section 1129(a)(3)&nbsp;of the 
Bankruptcy Code.&#160; In determining that the Plan has been proposed in good 
faith, the Court has examined the totality of the circumstances surrounding the 
filing of the Chapter 11 Cases and the formulation of the Plan.&#160; The 
Debtors&#146; good faith is evident from the facts and record of the Chapter 11 
Cases, the Disclosure Statement, and the record of the Confirmation 
Hearing.&#160; The Plan was proposed with the legitimate and honest purpose of 
maximizing the value of the Debtors&#146; Estates and to effectuate a successful
reorganization of the Debtors.&#160; The Plan was the product of extensive 
negotiations conducted at arm&#146;s length among the Debtors and certain of 
their key stakeholders.&#160; Further, the Plan&#146;s classification, 
indemnification, settlement, discharge, exculpation, release, and injunction 
provisions have been negotiated in good faith and at arm&#146;s length, are 
consistent with sections 105, 1122, 1123(b)(6), 1129, and 1142 of the Bankruptcy
Code, and are each necessary for the Debtors&#146; successful 
reorganization.&#160; Accordingly, the requirements of section 1129(a)
(3)&nbsp;of the Bankruptcy Code are satisfied.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">62.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The 
Debtors have proposed the Plan with the legitimate and honest purposes of 
maximizing the value of each of the Debtors&#146; Estates for the benefit of 
their stakeholders.&#160; The Plan gives effect to many of the Debtors&#146; 
restructuring initiatives, including implementing a value maximizing 
restructuring transaction.&#160; Accordingly, the Debtors (and all of their 
respective stockholders, members, officers, directors, agents, financial 
advisers, attorneys, employees, partners, Affiliates, and representatives) have 
been, are, and will continue to act in good faith if they proceed to:&#160; 
(a)&nbsp;consummate the Plan and the Restructuring Transactions and the 
agreements, settlements, transactions, and transfers contemplated thereby; and 
(b)&nbsp;take the </font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">29<a name="PB_29_122917_7608"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade 
align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='29',FILE='C:\JMS\105039\16-16038-1\task8047770\16038-1-ks-
05.htm',USER='105039',CD='Aug  3 12:29 2016' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">actions authorized and directed or contemplated by 
this Confirmation Order.&#160; Therefore, the Plan has been proposed in good 
faith to achieve a result consistent with the objectives and purposes of the 
Bankruptcy Code and the aforementioned parties have acted in good faith within 
the meaning of sections 1125(e)&nbsp;and 1126(e)&nbsp;the Bankruptcy 
Code.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">63.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 
(a)&nbsp;The Debtors&#146; admissions and releases contained in the Cash 
Collateral Order are hereby binding upon the Debtors, the Committee and all 
other parties in interest for all purposes as set forth in paragraph 
22(a)&nbsp;and paragraph 23 of the Cash Collateral Order, (b)&nbsp;the 
obligations of the Debtors under the First Lien Loan Documents and Second Lien 
Loan Documents (each as defined in the Cash Collateral Order) shall constitute 
allowed claims for all purposes in these Chapter 11 Cases, (c)&nbsp;the 
Prepetition Secured Parties&#146; security interests in and liens upon the 
Prepetition Collateral (each as defined in the Cash Collateral Order) shall be 
deemed to have been, as of the Petition Date, legal, valid, binding and 
perfected first and second priority security interests, as applicable, not 
subject to recharacterization, subordination or otherwise avoidable, and 
(d)&nbsp;the First Lien Prepetition Indebtedness, the Second Lien Prepetition 
Indebtedness and the Prepetition Secured Parties&#146; security interests in and
liens on the Prepetition Collateral (each as defined in the Cash Collateral 
Order) shall not be subject to any other or further challenge by the Committee 
or any other party in interest seeking to exercise the rights of the 
Debtors&#146; estates (including, without limitation, any successor 
thereto).</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">BASED ON THE FORGOING,&nbsp;IT IS HEREBY 
ORDERED THAT:</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-

size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">A.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-

style="font-weight:bold;">Confirmation.</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">64.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; The Plan
and the other Plan Documents shall be, and hereby are, confirmed under section 
1129 of the Bankruptcy Code.&#160; The terms of the Plan Documents are 
incorporated by reference into, and are an integral part of, the Plan and this 
Confirmation Order and are authorized and approved, and the Debtors are 
authorized to implement their provisions and consummate the Plan without any 
further authorization except as expressly required by the Plan or this 
Confirmation Order.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-

60;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><u 
style="font-weight:bold;">Objections.</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">65.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; All 
objections, responses, reservations, statements, and comments in opposition to 
the Plan, other than those resolved or withdrawn with prejudice prior to, or on 
the record at, the Confirmation Hearing are overruled on the merits in all 
respects.&#160; All withdrawn objections, if any, are deemed withdrawn with 
prejudice.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-

Provisions.</u></b></p>

style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

New Roman" style="font-

failure to specifically describe or include any particular provision of the Plan
or the Plan Documents in this Confirmation Order shall not diminish or impair 
the effectiveness of such provision, and such provision shall have the same 
validity, binding effect and enforceability as every other provision of the Plan
and the Plan Documents.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-

accordance with section 1127 of the Bankruptcy Code and Bankruptcy 
Rule&nbsp;3019, all Holders of Claims who voted to accept the Plan or who are 
conclusively presumed to have accepted the Plan are deemed to accept the Plan, 
subject to modifications, if any. &#160;No Holder of a Claim shall be permitted 
to change its vote as a consequence of the Plan </font></p>

style="font-size:10.0pt;">modifications.&#160; All modifications to the Plan 
made after the Solicitation Date are hereby approved, pursuant to section 1127 
of the Bankruptcy Code and Bankruptcy Rule&nbsp;3019.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">68.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 
<u>General Authorization</u>.&#160; The transactions described in the Plan, the 
other Plan Documents, and this Confirmation Order are hereby approved.&#160; On 
or before the Effective Date, and after the Effective Date, as necessary, and 
without any further order of the Court or other authority, the Debtors, the 
Reorganized Debtors, or New Holdco and their respective directors, officers, 
members, agents, attorneys, financial advisors, and investment bankers are 
authorized and empowered pursuant to section 1142(b)&nbsp;of the Bankruptcy Code
and other applicable laws to and shall (a)&nbsp;grant, issue, execute, deliver, 
file, or record any agreement, document, or security, and the documents 
contained in the Plan or the Plan Documents (as modified, amended, and 
supplemented pursuant to the provisions of the Plan governing such 
modifications, amendments, and supplements), in substantially the form included 
therein, or any other documents related thereto and (b)&nbsp;take any action 
necessary or appropriate to implement, effectuate, and consummate the Plan, the 
Plan Documents, or this Confirmation Order, in accordance with their 
terms.&#160; All such actions taken or caused to be taken shall be deemed to 
have been authorized and approved by the Court without further approval, act, or
action under any applicable law, order, rule, or regulation, including, among
other things, (a)&nbsp;all transfers of assets that are to occur pursuant to the
Plan, the Plan Documents, or this Confirmation Order; (b)&nbsp;the incurrence of
all obligations contemplated by the Plan, the Plan Documents, or this 
Confirmation Order and the making of all distributions under the Plan, the Plan 
Documents, or this Confirmation Order; and (c)&nbsp;entering into any and all 
transactions, contracts, leases, instruments, releases, and other documents and 
arrangements permitted by applicable law, order, rule, or regulation.&#160; The 
approvals and authorizations specifically set forth in this Confirmation Order 
are nonexclusive </font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">and are not intended to limit the authority of the 
Debtors, the Reorganized Debtors, or New Holdco or any officer or director 
thereof to take any and all actions necessary or appropriate to implement, 
effectuate, and consummate any and all documents or transactions contemplated by
the Plan or this Confirmation Order pursuant to section 1142(b)&nbsp;of the 
Bankruptcy Code.&#160; Pursuant to section 1142 of the Bankruptcy Code, to the 
extent that, under applicable nonbankruptcy law or the rules&nbsp;of any stock 
exchange, any of the foregoing actions that would otherwise require approval of 
the equity holders or directors (or any equivalent body) of the Debtors, the 
Reorganized Debtors, or New Holdco such approval (including any board resolution
required to confirm that the New Common Stock shall be uncertificated) shall be 
deemed to have occurred and shall be in effect from and after the Effective Date
without any further action by the equity holders or directors (or any equivalent
body) of the Debtors, the Reorganized Debtors, or New Holdco.&#160; On the 
Effective Date, or as soon thereafter as is practicable, the Debtors, the 
Reorganized Debtors, or New Holdco, as applicable, shall, if required, file any 
documents required to be filed in such jurisdictions so as to effectuate the 
provisions of the Plan.&#160; Any or all documents contemplated herein shall be 
accepted by each of the respective filing offices and recorded, if required, in 
accordance with applicable law.&#160; All counterparties to any documents 
described in this paragraph are hereby directed to execute such documents as may
be required or provided by such documents, without any further order of the 
Court.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-

Action.</u>&#160; Pursuant to the appropriate provisions of the New York 
Business Corporation Law, the General Corporation Law of the State of Delaware 
(including section 303 thereof), section 1142(b)&nbsp;of the Bankruptcy Code, or
other applicable law, this Confirmation Order shall constitute authorization for
the Debtors, the Reorganized Debtors, or New Holdco to enter into, execute, 
deliver, file, adopt, amend, restate, consummate, or effectuate, as the case 
</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">may be, the Plan, the Plan Documents, this 
Confirmation Order, and any contract, instrument, or other document to be 
executed, delivered, adopted, or amended in connection with the implementation 
of the Plan, and the respective directors, stockholders, managers, or members of
the Debtors or the Reorganized Debtors shall not be required to take any actions
in connection with the implementation of the Plan, the Plan Documents, or this 
Confirmation Order.&#160; The Plan Documents are hereby approved, adopted and 
effective upon the Effective Date.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-

60;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 
</font><b><u style="font-weight:bold;">Binding Effect.</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">70.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; On the 
date of and after entry of this Confirmation Order and subject to the occurrence
of the Effective Date, the Plan, the Plan Documents, and this Confirmation Order
shall bind any Holder of a Claim or Interest and such Holder&#146;s respective 
successors and assigns, whether or not:&#160; (a)&nbsp;the Claim or Interest is 
Impaired under the Plan; (b)&nbsp;such Holder has accepted the Plan; 
(c)&nbsp;such Holder has failed to vote to accept or reject the Plan or voted to
reject the Plan; (d)&nbsp;such Holder is entitled to a distribution under the 
Plan; (e)&nbsp;such Holder will receive or retain any property or interests in 
property under the Plan; and (f)&nbsp;such Holder has filed a Proof of Claim in 
the Chapter 11 Cases.&#160; The Plan, the Plan Documents, and this Confirmation 
Order constitute legal, valid, binding, and authorized obligations of the 
respective parties thereto and shall be enforceable in accordance with their 
terms.&#160; Pursuant to section 1142(a)&nbsp;of the Bankruptcy Code, the Plan, 
the Plan Documents, and this Confirmation Order shall apply and be enforceable 
notwithstanding any otherwise applicable nonbankruptcy law.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-

Stock.</u></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-

Effective Date, the Reorganized Debtors and New Holdco shall enter into the New 
Organizational Documents, and the New Organizational Documents shall, as of the
Effective Date, be valid, binding, and enforceable in accordance with their 
terms, and each Holder of New Common Stock and Warrants (as applicable) shall be
bound thereby, in each case </font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='34',FILE='C:\JMS\105039\16-16038-1\task8047770\16038-1-ks-

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">without the need for execution by any party thereto 
other than the Reorganized Debtors or New Holdco.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">72.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Except 
for shares of the New Common Stock to be delivered pursuant to the Management 
Incentive Plan, each Person or Entity that receives shares of New Common Stock 
pursuant to the Plan shall automatically be deemed to be a party to the 
Stockholders&#146; Agreement and the Registration Rights Agreement, in 
accordance with their terms, whether it receives shares on or after the 
Effective Date and regardless of whether it executes a signature page&nbsp;to 
the Stockholders&#146; Agreement or the Registration Rights Agreement.&#160; 
Subject to, and upon the occurrence of, the Effective Date, and without further 
notice to any party, or further order or other approval of the Court, or further
act or action under applicable law, regulation, order or rule, or the vote, 
consent, authorization or approval of any Person, the Stockholders&#146; 
Agreement and the Registration Rights Agreement are approved and shall be valid 
and binding on the Reorganized Debtors and all holders of New Common Stock 
issued pursuant to the Plan.&#160; Except for shares of New Common Stock to be 
delivered pursuant to the Management Incentive Plan, (a)&nbsp;all New Common 
Stock and Warrants issued pursuant to the Plan shall be subject to the terms of 
the Stockholders&#146; Agreement and (b)&nbsp;all New Common Stock issued 
pursuant to the Plan shall be subject to the terms of the Registration Rights 
Agreement.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">73.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Each 
Person or Entity that receives Tranche 1 Warrants pursuant to the Plan shall 
automatically be deemed to be a party to the Tranche 1 Warrant Agreement, in 
accordance with its terms.&#160; Subject to, and upon the occurrence of, the 
Effective Date, and without further notice to any party, or further order or 
other approval of the Court, or further act or action under applicable law, 
regulation, order or rule, or the vote, consent, authorization or approval of 
any Person, the Tranche 1 Warrant Agreement is approved and shall be valid and 
binding on the </font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">35<a name="PB_35_124710_8627"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade 
align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='35',FILE='C:\JMS\105039\16-16038-1\task8047770\16038-1-ks-
07.htm',USER='105039',CD='Aug  3 12:49 2016' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Reorganized Debtors, New Holdco and all holders of 
Tranche 1 Warrants issued pursuant to the Plan.&#160; Each Person or Entity that
receives Tranche 2 Warrants pursuant to the Plan shall automatically be deemed 
to be a party to the Tranche 2 Warrant Agreement, in accordance with its 
terms.&#160; Subject to, and upon the occurrence of, the Effective Date, and 
without further notice to any party, or further order or other approval of the 
Court, or further act or action under applicable law, regulation, order or rule,
or the vote, consent, authorization or approval of any Person, the Tranche 2 
Warrant Agreement is approved and shall be valid and binding on the Reorganized 
Debtors, New Holdco and all holders of Tranche 2 Warrants issued pursuant to the
Plan.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">74.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; In 
accordance with the Management Incentive Plan, 7% of the New Common Stock shall 
be reserved to grant equity awards to certain employee groups.&#160; Within 60 
days after the Effective Date, 71.43% of such shares will be granted in the form
of restricted stock unit awards and allocated among New Holdco&#146;s key 
officers and employees as identified in and in accordance with the Management 
Incentive Plan Documents.&#160; Participants&#146; (as defined in the Management
Incentive Plan Documents) participation in the Management Incentive Plan and 
their respective Awards (as defined in the Management Incentive Plan Documents) 
shall each be subject to the terms and conditions set forth in the Management 
Incentive Plan Documents and any applicable Award Agreement (as defined in the 
Management Incentive Plan Documents).</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">75.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Pursuant
to section 1145 of the Bankruptcy Code, the issuance of the New Common Stock and
the Warrants, as contemplated by the Plan, shall be exempt from, among other 
things, the registration requirements of Section&nbsp;5 of the Securities Act 
and any other applicable U.S., state, or local law requiring registration prior 
to the offering, issuance, distribution, or sale of securities.&#160; In 
addition, under section 1145 of the Bankruptcy Code, any </font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">36<a name="PB_36_124733_7906"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade 
align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>
